basics.name: Andrew McOlash
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: He is a Software Engineer at PerBlue. When not staring deeply into a text editor (usually vim, VS Code or Eclipse) and trying to solve all of the problems, he likes to bike and relax with video games. Making, developing, and 'hacking' are his passions.

work.summary: Worked on developing and implementing new content into the mobile role playing games Disney Heroes: Battle Mode, Portal Quest, and DragonSoul at PerBlue. Worked on implementing unique combat logic, content (new heroes, environments and game modes) and developing tooling for both the art team and quality assurance team.
highlights: Continual improvement of game by working closely with multiple teams within the studio
Develop tools for both the art teams and quality assurance teams to improve workflows
Implement new types of combat logic and mechanics
Refactor large sections of the codebase to improve and implement new systems to make development of new characters easier and faster

work.company: Survey of the Heath of Wisconsin (SHOW)
work.summary: Drafting and development for a new website/webapp that displays health statistics and public health information. This portal provides a simple way to quickly see public health information collected from SHOW.
highlights: Used web technologies including Handlebars, Yeoman, Grunt and Bower
Quick iterations of the website for both layout and functionality

work.summary: Development of mobile responsive internal web applications. Worked on creating a simplified process for engaging the Mobile team using external APIs.
highlights: Develop a greater understanding of web technologies
Used web technologies including EmberJS, NodeJS, Twitter Bootstrap and Grunt
Closely work with MVC pattern in multiple app environments

work.summary: Work with students and office staff to organize and coordinate residence hall activities as well as designing publicity for the events. Provide tours for perspective students and provide information about the residence hall.
highlights: Create event publicity for residence hall events and gatherings
Work with students and faculty to coordinate events

volunteer.summary: Helped to tutor GED students with algebra, geometry and statistics. Assisted in personal learning plans as well as recording progress each week. Used different techniques based on each students needs to help with retention of materials.

Work with young children to help them learn about technology. Assist children making music with SonicPi - an open source live coding music synthesizer, as well as Bitsbox - a service which allows users to learn to write real code and make games.

Held several leadership positions, led activities, taught skills to scouts, organized food drives, fund raised, and assisted in planning troop projects. Led a middle-school FIRST Lego League team as head coach for Eagle project.
